definition: fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
to beat/to hit/variant of 考[kao3]/to inspect/to test/to take an exam
to check/to verify/to test/to examine/to take an exam/to take an entrance exam for/deceased father
to warm oneself at a fire
to scorch/(of the sun) to beat down on

sentences.english: The cook baked a cake . The cake was baked too long. The cake is as hard as rock.
sentences.chinese: 厨子烤了一块饼，烤饼的时间太长了，硬得像石头。

sentences.english: Place on a prepared tray, brush the tops lightly with egg.
sentences.chinese: 放在铺好烤纸的烤盘上，刷上蛋液入预热烤箱。

sentences.english: Place on a prepared tray, brush the tops lightly with egg.
sentences.chinese: 放在铺好烤纸的烤盘上，刷上蛋液入预热烤箱。

sentences.english: The cook baked a cake. The cake was baked too long. The cake is as hard as rock.
sentences.chinese: 厨子烤了一块饼，饼烤的时间太长，硬得像石头。

sentences.english: The cook baked a cake. The cake was baked too long. The cake is as hard as rock.
sentences.chinese: 厨子烤了一块饼，饼烤的时间太长，硬得像石头。

sentences.english: He felt the heat of the fire on his face.
sentences.chinese: 他感到火把他的脸烤得热烘烘的。

sentences.english: The roast beef and deviled crab are very good today.
sentences.chinese: 今天的烤生肉和炒辣味蟹都很好。

sentences.english: They decided to have something to eat before going to home, but unfortunately the only spot open was a seedy bar-and-grill with a questionable reputation.
sentences.chinese: 但很不巧只有一家名声不好的下等酒吧烤菜馆开着门。

sentences.english: For a month the hot sun has been parching the fields.
sentences.chinese: 一个月以来，烈日一直灼烤着田野。

sentences.english: He discovered, by some accident, that flesh roasted in front of afire tasted better.
sentences.chinese: 他意外地发现，在火前烤过的肉尝起来更好。

sentences.english: Place the pie on a wire rack and cool to room temperature.
sentences.chinese: 烤好之后将派放在铁架上冷却至室温。

sentences.english: Bake them whole or mash them with a bit of milk.
sentences.chinese: 整个拿去烤或是伴着点牛奶捣成泥都可以。

sentences.english: The baked apples are spluttering in the oven.
sentences.chinese: 这些烤苹果在烤箱内劈里啪啦地响。

sentences.english: Place tablespoonfuls of mixture onto a baking paper lined tray. Flatten slightly with a floured fork.
sentences.chinese: 汤勺将混合勺满烤纸，叉将其稍微压扁。

sentences.english: The green production with hot rotating furnace and tunnel stove roast.
sentences.chinese: 该机生产的生坯采用热风旋转炉及隧道炉烤均可。

sentences.english: After grilled. Use the fruit knife cut it into 4 small pieces.
sentences.chinese: 等东西烤好后，用尖刀把它切成四小块。

definition: to scorch/(of the sun) to beat down on
to evaporate/(of cooking) to steam/torch made from hemp stalks or bamboo (old)/finely chopped firewood (old)
(dialect) to cook in salt or sand, inside a sealed pot/to steam/to bake
to cook in a covered vessel/to casserole/to stew
